overview: This capstone project will provide the culmination of the Master of Data Science degree. It will apply the skills developed during the degree to a practical problem of relevance to science, industry, commerce or society in general. Students will continue to work in their teams established in MAST90106 Data Science Project Part 1, again under only general guidance from staff members. They are expected to present technically correct results in a fashion acceptable to industry-based and other clients.Students will be continue to be expected to complete diaries to log their work on the project so that the extent of their contribution to group projects can be determined. In this part of the project students will complete the project and present a group project report and oral presentation.

necessary pre-requisite: Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)

assessments.description: A literature review and project plan completed by the research group. 5 pages. Hurdle requirement
A written report totaling 6,000 words, or equivalent completed by the research group. 6000 words (equivalent)

Semester 2.Coordinators: Michael Kirley, Joyce Zhang, and Feng Liu

Semester 2.Contact hours: Up to 10 hours comprising one initial 2 hour workshop to form groups and discuss the form of the project, one 1 hour workshop on research ethics, one 2 hour workshop towards the end of the first semester to discuss the project’s progress and up to 5 hours informal contact with the subject coordinator.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Related Handbook entries: This subject contributes to the following:
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
